headline: Idaho Lt. Gov. Ends Interview After Being Pressed About White Nationalist Ties
author: Josephine Harvey
sentences:
There’s thousands and thousands of young conservatives all across the country that are very concerned about what’s happening to our country.”
She announced “interview’s over” when the reporter noted that she had also been linked to to Vincent James Foxx, head of the white nationalist website Red Elephants, and that it was “not the first time” she’d been associated with this circle.

In her AFPAC address, McGeachin told attendees she would fight to “make Idaho great again” and said she needed “freedom fighters all over this country that are willing to stand up and fight,” even if it meant fighting among Republican ranks, because too many “don’t exhibit the courage today,” according to the Daily Beast.

In a Feb. 28 interview that went viral on Wednesday, reporter Brian Holmes of Boise’s KTVB-TV asked McGeachin about her video appearance at the America First Political Action Conference in Orlando, Florida, several days earlier.
When asked if she would have spoken at the event had she known who Fuentes was, McGeachin said: “Well, again, this movement is so much bigger than one individual.
Other speakers at AFPAC included Republican Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (Ga.) and Paul Gosar (Ariz.), and Arizona state Sen. Wendy Rogers, also a Republican.
Janice McGeachin declared an interview “over” last month when she was repeatedly pressed to explain her appearance at a recent white nationalist conference.
Like Nick Fuentes?” Holmes asked, referring to the prominent white nationalist and antisemitic podcaster who organized the event she spoke at.
The back-and-forth continued for several minutes as Holmes pushed for a clear response while McGeachin danced around questions.
She is running for governor and has been endorsed by former President Donald Trump.
McGeachin has faced calls for her resignation over the incident.
“Did you not look into it before you decided to say OK?
“Are you familiar with who puts this event on?
I don’t know who he is,” McGeachin replied.
I mean, his name is on it,” Holmes pressed.
McGeachin insisted she didn’t know him.
Who cares what Nick Fuentes has to say?
“I don’t, I don’t know who he is.
I’ve never met him.
Like to find out?
Idaho Lt. Gov.
Who cares?
Related...
I don’t.
